com.smartnsoft.droid4me.ws

Interface WebServiceClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WebServiceCaller

    public interface WebServiceClient
    A minimalist contract when creating a web service client.
    Since:
    2011.08.17
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  WebServiceClient.CallException
      The exception that will be thrown if any problem occurs during a web service call.
      static class  WebServiceClient.CallType
      Defines the way the HTTP method is run, and enables to link a call code with it.
      static class  WebServiceClient.HttpCallTypeAndBody
      Indicates the type of HTTP request and the underlying HTTP.
      static class  WebServiceClient.Verb
      An HTTP method type.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Is responsible for converting the given URI parameters into a stringified URI.

      Is responsible to actually run the relevant HTTP method.

    • Method Detail

      • computeUri

        java.lang.String computeUri(java.lang.String methodUriPrefix,
                          java.lang.String methodUriSuffix,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> uriParameters)
        Is responsible for converting the given URI parameters into a stringified URI.
        Parameters:
        methodUriPrefix - the prefix of the URI
        methodUriSuffix - the suffix of the URI, not containing the query parameters. A / will split the methodUriPrefix and methodUriSuffix parameters in the final URI
        uriParameters - a map of key/values that will be used as query parameters in the final URI
        Returns:
        a properly encoded URI

      • getInputStream

        java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.lang.String uri,
                                 WebServiceClient.CallType callType,
                                 org.apache.http.HttpEntity body)
                                   throws WebServiceClient.CallException
        Is responsible to actually run the relevant HTTP method.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI against which the HTTP request should be run
        callType - the type of HTTP method
        body - the body of the HTTP method, in case of a WebServiceClient.CallType.Post or WebServiceClient.CallType.Put method; null otherwise
        Returns:
        the input stream resulting to the HTTP request, which is taken from the response
        Throws:
        WebServiceClient.CallException - in case an error occurred during the HTTP request execution, or if the HTTP request status code is not 2XX
